meanings.definition: A type of fastening device or clasp.
meanings.sent1: She used an agrafe to secure her necklace.
meanings.sent2: The agrafe on the bracelet broke, so she couldn't wear it.
meanings.sent3: The agrafe decided to take a break and refused to hold anything together.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like an agrafe, holding her heart together.
meanings.sent5: The shiny agrafe gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A decorative ornament used in bookbinding.
meanings.sent1: The old book had a beautiful agrafe on its cover.
meanings.sent2: She carefully added an agrafe to the spine of the book.
meanings.sent3: The agrafe on the book seemed to wink at her mischievously.
meanings.sent4: The agrafe on the book was like a tiny jewel, adding elegance to the cover.
meanings.sent5: The intricate agrafe on the book was a work of art in itself.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with an agrafe.
meanings.sent1: She decided to agrafe the papers together to keep them organized.
meanings.sent2: He carefully agrafed the fabric to create a neat seam.
meanings.sent3: The magician agrafed the pieces of the torn paper back together.
meanings.sent4: Her words agrafed their hearts, bringing them closer together.
meanings.sent5: The bond between them was agrafed with trust and understanding.
